title: Celtics bench shines in bounce-back win over Magic: 7 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Celtics bench excelled in a 111-107 win against Orlando Magic, led by Luka Garza's strong performance.
Luka Garza contributed 16 points in 17 minutes, boosting the Celtics' depth at center.
Jordan Walsh's defensive play and crucial late-game three-pointer highlighted his emerging role in the lineup.

title: Jason Varitek is happy to be back with Red Sox on a new deal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jason Varitek signed a new contract to remain with the Boston Red Sox as the game-planning and run prevention coach.
Varitek has been with the Red Sox for 28 years, serving as a player and in various coaching roles since 2012.
He cited the presence of talented players like Carlos Narvaez as a factor in his decision to stay with the team.

title: Patriots’ explosive rookie class breaks through at perfect time in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rookie Kyle Williams scored his first career touchdown and TreVeyon Henderson delivered two touchdowns in Patriots' win.
Williams and Henderson contributed 222 of New England's 435 total net yards in a 28-23 victory over Tampa Bay.
Patriots' rookies, including offensive linemen Will Campbell and Jared Wilson, played key roles in securing the team's seventh consecutive win.

title: Oddsmakers have Drake Maye as NFL MVP favorite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Drake Maye, Patriots quarterback, is the current NFL MVP frontrunner, according to FanDuel, with odds at +250.
Maye led the Patriots to a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers, throwing for 270 yards and two touchdowns.
Following a Bills loss, Maye's performance and Patriots winning streak extend his lead over Josh Allen and Patrick Mahomes.

title: Rob Gronkowski announces that he will ‘retire as a Patriot’
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rob Gronkowski plans to sign a one-day contract with the Patriots to officially retire with the team.
Gronkowski joined the Tampa Bay Buccaneers for two seasons after playing nine seasons with the Patriots.
Gronkowski's accolades include three Super Bowl wins with the Patriots and holding their record for career receiving touchdowns.

title: Patriots stock watch: Here’s who stood out and struggled against the Buccaneers
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams played pivotal roles in the Patriots' 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers.
Elijah Ponder recorded his first career sack, showcasing persistence as he tackled Buccaneers quarterback Baker Mayfield.
The Patriots' offensive line improved, allowing only one sack and creating opportunities for the rushing game.

title: 10 takeaways from Patriots’ impressive road win over Buccaneers
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots extend their win streak to seven games with a 28-23 victory over the Buccaneers in Tampa.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Kyle Williams accounted for three of New England's touchdowns, showcasing explosive performance.
Quarterback Drake Maye threw for 270 yards and two touchdowns, despite a late-game interception against Tampa Bay.

title: MBTA Transit Police officer facing drunk driving charge after allegedly crashing into pole
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Transit Police Officer Jonathan Daveiga was arrested on Oct. 19 for allegedly driving under the influence and crashing into a pole.
Daveiga, 27, pleaded not guilty and was released on personal recognizance; he's been placed on 'modified duty.'
State Police reported Daveiga refused a breathalyzer; next court date is Dec. 19 in Charlestown Municipal Court.

title: Allston Car Wash employees still in federal custody after ICE raid
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nine Allston Car Wash employees detained by ICE have work permits but remain in custody since a November 4 raid.
Attorney Todd Pomerleau reports difficulties obtaining information about detainees, who allegedly faced mistreatment while in ICE custody.
Rep. Ayanna Pressley and City Councilor Liz Breadon criticized the raid, describing it as 'cruel' and 'kidnapping'.

title: ‘SNL’ recap: Best moments from Nikki Glaser hosting ‘Saturday Night Live’
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: Nikki Glaser hosted 'Saturday Night Live' on Nov. 8, with Sombr as the musical guest.
Glaser gained prominence after a standout performance at the 2024 Tom Brady roast.
The episode featured Pete Davidson's return to the 'Weekend Update' desk.
